result.markdown: --- title: "Week 2: Foundations of R Programming" --- ::: {.cell} ::: ## Main reference * [4-8, *Advanced R*](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/foundations-intro.html) ## What you will learn this week * Subsetting * Control flow * Functions * Environments * Conditions ## Pre-class activities * Watch the following series of short videos on **subsetting in R**: * [Subsetting R objects: Basics](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Plcy3qM8wEE) * [Subsetting R objects: Lists](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7j6C1w9x9hw) * [Subsetting R objects: Matrices](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=83NSymr6pPw) * [Subsetting R objects: Partial matching](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kb4lXR6Z-Hc) * [Subsetting R objects: Removing missing values](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PYpIVFS6xwU) * Write a function `linear`, that takes arguments `x`, `a` and `b`, and returns `a + b * x`. Give default values `a=1` and `b=0`, and make sure your function has sensible error messages when the inputs are not as expected. Your function should work when `x` is a numerical scalar, vector, or matrix. ## Slides for week Download pdf ## Assignments * [Assignment 1](../assignments/A1.qmd) is due on Tuesday 31 March.
